nl.tudelft.jpacman.sprite

Class AnimatedSprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tudelft.jpacman.sprite.AnimatedSprite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sprite

    public class AnimatedSprite
extends java.lang.Object
implements Sprite
    Animated sprite, renders the frame depending on the time of requesting the draw.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AnimatedSprite(Sprite[] frames, int delay, boolean loop)
      Creates a new animating sprite that will change frames every interval.
      AnimatedSprite(Sprite[] frames, int delay, boolean loop, boolean isAnimating)
      Creates a new animating sprite that will change frames every interval.

    • Method Summary

      Returns the width of this sprite.

      (Re)starts the current animation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnimatedSprite

        public AnimatedSprite(Sprite[] frames,
                      int delay,
                      boolean loop)
        Creates a new animating sprite that will change frames every interval. By default the sprite is not animating.
        Parameters:
        frames - The frames of this animation.
        delay - The delay between frames.
        loop - Whether or not this sprite should be looping.

      • AnimatedSprite

        public AnimatedSprite(Sprite[] frames,
                      int delay,
                      boolean loop,
                      boolean isAnimating)
        Creates a new animating sprite that will change frames every interval.
        Parameters:
        frames - The frames of this animation.
        delay - The delay between frames.
        loop - Whether or not this sprite should be looping.
        isAnimating - Whether or not this sprite is animating from the start.

    • Method Detail

      • setAnimating

        public void setAnimating(boolean isAnimating)
        Starts or stops the animation of this sprite.
        Parameters:
        isAnimating - true to animate this sprite or false to stop animating this sprite.

      • restart

        public void restart()
        (Re)starts the current animation.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g,
                 int x,
                 int y,
                 int width,
                 int height)
        Description copied from interface: Sprite
        Draws the sprite on the provided graphics context.
        Specified by:
        draw in interface Sprite
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics context to draw.
        x - The destination x coordinate to start drawing.
        y - The destination y coordinate to start drawing.
        width - The width of the destination draw area.
        height - The height of the destination draw area.

      • split

        public Sprite split(int x,
                    int y,
                    int width,
                    int height)
        Description copied from interface: Sprite
        Returns a portion of this sprite as a new Sprite.
        Specified by:
        split in interface Sprite
        Parameters:
        x - The x start coordinate.
        y - The y start coordinate.
        width - The width of the target sprite.
        height - The height of the target sprite.
        Returns:
        A new sprite of width x height, or a new EmptySprite if the region was not in the current sprite.
